page.title: 03ECOLOGY 1
page.content: Underlying rocks are millstone grit and shales; rounded hillocks are of boulder clay. Lying between the west coast and Pennines, the area has high rainfall, average 43.35 inches over last 16 years. Rain fell every day in August 1985 ( Total 7.043 in.) Lanes are bordered by hedges, those of Barnoldswick Lane of sycamore, ash, elm, hawthorn, hazel, sloe, alder, briar rose, holly and guelder rose. In this lane are >70 varieties of wild flower. Deciduous trees are mainly beech , ash , oak , sycamore , horse-chestnut & elm. Several trees have died of Dutch Elm disease this year. Herons, pied- and yellow- wagtails, dippers, kingfishers and goosanders are seen by the river & long-tailed tits, tree- creepers, jays and woodpeckers are sometimes seen in gardens. mmmm
